Matthew Kvalheim     Research

Matthew Kvalheim

Postdoctoral Researcher

Email: kvalheim@umich.edu

Here is my CV.

I am a postdoctoral Assistant Professor in the Department of Mathematics at the University of Michigan. My research interests are nonlinear systems in general, and in particular dynamics and control, geometry and topology, and stochastic processes.

Some recent presentation materials:

  • Slides from a talk at the Cornell Probability Seminar. Topic: “flux” in small-noise dynamical systems.
  • Slides from a talk at the U Michigan Control Seminar. Topic: topological approaches to the stabilizability/safety problems in control theory.
  • Video from a talk at the Rutgers TRIPODS/DATA-INSPIRE institute. Topic: Conley’s fundamental theorem for “hybrid” dynamical systems.
